result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony A Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony A Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Anthony A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Corey R. Flynn has not received discovery and/or an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Johnson in court. Attorney Foley VanLieshout appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.
